main event: A star-like object with white color was observed traveling eastward, wavering in flight, then continuing on a straight flight path for 45 seconds.
interesting points: The object seemed faster than it should have been.
The report was made by a ground-radar and air-visual observation.
The report mentions concurrence with the reporting officer that the sighting was possibly an aircraft.
The report indicates there was a lot of air activity over Long Island, both land and marine, at the time.
The report concludes the sighting was possibly an aircraft.
sighted object: one star-like object with white color
